meanings.definition: Holding traditional attitudes and values, especially in politics.
meanings.sent1: The ultraconservative politician always voted to keep things the same.
meanings.sent2: She was known for her ultraconservative views on government spending.
meanings.sent3: The ultraconservative group insisted on using only old-fashioned methods for their campaign.
meanings.sent4: His ultraconservative approach to policy was like trying to turn back the clock.
meanings.sent5: The ultraconservative stance on the issue was as firm as a stone wall.

meanings.definition: A person who holds extreme conservative views.
meanings.sent1: The ultraconservative was against any change in the laws.
meanings.sent2: As an ultraconservative, he believed in upholding traditional values.
meanings.sent3: The ultraconservative at the meeting refused to consider any new ideas.
meanings.sent4: She was an ultraconservative, always advocating for the status quo.
meanings.sent5: The ultraconservative's presence was as solid as a mountain in the group.

meanings.sent1: The company had an ultraconservative approach to adopting new technologies.
meanings.sent2: The town's policies were ultraconservative, rarely changing over the years.
meanings.sent3: The ultraconservative design of the building made it stand out in the modern city.
meanings.sent4: Her ultraconservative views on fashion clashed with the latest trends.
meanings.sent5: The ultraconservative nature of the organization was deeply rooted in tradition.
